title: 113_s2653
content: The "Homeless Children and Youth Act of 2014" is cited as the short title for this Act. Amendments to the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act are included in this legislation. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to extend the time period for sharing information with charitable organizations from 14 days to 30 days. Clause (ii) is removed and clause (iii) is redesignated as clause (ii) in section 103. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include unaccompanied youth and homeless families certified as lacking fixed nighttime residence. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include definitions for "other Federal statute" and "public housing agency." The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include the term "other Federal statute" which encompasses specific federal laws such as the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act, the Head Start Act, the Violence Against Women Act, and the Public Health Service Act. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include references to various federal laws such as the Child Nutrition Act of 1966, the Higher Education Act of 1965, and other relevant statutes. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include references to various federal laws such as the Child Nutrition Act of 1966, the Higher Education Act of 1965, and other relevant statutes. SEC. 409 states the availability of HMIS report. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act requires the Secretary to make information on homelessness publicly available online in aggregate reports. The reports must include counts of homeless individuals and families, patterns of assistance provided, and data from the Homeless Management Information System. The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act mandates the Secretary to publish homelessness data online. This includes counts of homeless individuals and families, assistance patterns, and information from the Homeless Management Information System. In section 422, changes are made regarding grant awards, prioritization, and cost-effectiveness criteria. Section 424(d) is amended by removing paragraph (5). In section 427(b), amendments are made to subparagraphs (A) and (B) by adjusting various clauses and removing certain clauses. Amendments are made to section 433 by removing subparagraph (F) and redesignating subparagraph (G) as (F), as well as striking paragraph (3). The Secretary is required to submit an annual report to Congress summarizing activities, findings, and recommendations under this subtitle. The report must include data from the previous year and information on programs funded under other Federal statutes. The report must be submitted within 4 months after the end of each fiscal year.
